findings.metric: Fraction of tumor proteins represented in immunopeptidome
findings.interpretation: Broader antigen display was achieved after intratumoral mRNA vaccination.

findings.metric: Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome
findings.interpretation: The MHC-I-presented landscape expanded strongly after mRNA vaccination.
Vaccinated patients had improved survival while receiving ICI treatment.

findings.metric: Type I interferon response score (normalized units)
findings.interpretation: Type I interferon signaling was markedly induced by the mRNA vaccine.

findings.metric: PD-L1 expression fold-change in tumor tissue
findings.interpretation: The checkpoint axis became more targetable after the vaccine plus anti-PD-L1 intervention.
Combination therapy increased immune infiltration in tumors.

controls_or_null_results.statement: Vaccine-only treatment did not produce durable tumor control in non-immunogenic models.
ICI-only treatment had limited activity in low-immunogenic baseline settings.
Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit.
